intro: Trachelium caeruleum subsp. halteratum, commonly known as the skyblue tansy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
